newsitem.title: USA: Tosco ramps up two units at Calif. refinery.
newsitem.headline: Tosco ramps up two units at Calif. refinery.

text.p: Tosco Corp said two refinery units returned to normal operation at its Rodeo, California, refinery early Thursday after a gas leak cut production the night before, a company spokeswoman said.
Operators late Wednesday cut back to minimum levels a coker and hydrocracker after the leak caused a sulfur processing unit to lose pressure.
"The refinery is currently operating normally," said Tosco spokesman David Kory. But he did not know if the two units had reached full capacity Thursday.
He declined to say what effect the cut backs had on customers shipments, but added planned maintenance was occuring at the time of the leak.
"There's a lot of other maintenance going on on other units," Kory said.
The leaking gas, a compound of hydrogen sulphide and sulphur dioxide, did not pose a health risk to nearby residents, the company said.

The leak was unrelated to another incident at the same refinery Wednesday morning when there was a briEf fire at a processing unit that had been taken down for maintenance. The fire was put out with disrupting operations.
Tosco recently bought the refinery from Unocal Corp along with the company's other downstream assets.
